ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you are interested in the most cutting-edge work in neuroscience and looking for new paths of study in analyzing behavioral decision making, you should definitely look into this course and see if it is for you.
I do not recommend this course if you do not have at least one neuro course under your belt.
I summarize it as a course looking at the intersection of neuroscience with economic theory. I'd recommend it to another student if it fit their educational goals.
A must-take if you are interested in decision neuroscience in human. A very good complement to Neuroscience 596, which focuses more on the monkey electrophys literature.Would definitely recommend it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: As an undergraduate, it has certainly made me start contemplating different concepts to test for a senior thesis.

It extended my thinking in a very different way than I am exposed to in my own discipline. It even got me to thinking of an alternative dissertation question, which ultimately won't be pursued (but the class was that thought-provoking).
Coming in with little neuroscience background, I learned a ton. Not sure yet how much I want to go down that road in my research, but if I end up doing so, it was an excellent starting point.
Very helpful. Expose me to a great breadth of the field
